data.description: Fundamentals of chemical measurement in chemistry, biology, engineering, geology, and the medical sciences. Topics include equilibria of complex systems, spectroscopy, electrochemistry, separations, and quantitative laboratory technique.
data.title: FUNDAMENTALS OF ANALYTICAL SCIENCE

data.description: Introduction to modeling of chemical processes and introduction to using modern computational tools to analyze the models.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO CHEMICAL PROCESS MODELING

data.description: Fundamentals of chemical measurement in chemistry, biology, engineering, geology, and the medical sciences. Topics include equilibria of complex systems, spectroscopy, electrochemistry, separations, and quantitative laboratory technique. Covers chemical equilibria in greater depth and with greater mathematical rigor thanCHEM 327.
data.title: FUNDAMENTALS OF ANALYTICAL SCIENCE

data.description: Introduction to thermodynamics, energy balances, applications to steady state and unsteady state processes, behavior of pure fluids, chemical reaction equilibria.
data.title: CHEMICAL PROCESS THERMODYNAMICS

data.description: An introduction to the invention of processes for the large scale, low cost processing of materials such as water, chemicals, petroleum products, food, drugs and wastes.
data.title: PROCESS SYNTHESIS

data.description: Various options for conversion of biomass into fuels and chemicals.  Evaluation of different biofuel technologies from a chemical engineering perspective, and a holistic overview of the current technical, legal, business, and financial challenges, and opportunities for the production of fuels and chemicals from biomass.  Several case studies on biomass conversion provide an overview of how technology is developed.
data.title: PROCESSES FOR THE PRODUCTION OF RENEWABLE FUELS AND CHEMICALS FROM BIOMASS

data.description: Vector spaces and linear transformations, differential calculus of scalar and vector fields, determinants, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, multiple integrals, line integrals, and surface integrals. Freshmen students are invited to enroll by the Department of Mathematics.
data.title: TOPICS IN MULTI-VARIABLE CALCULUS AND LINEAR ALGEBRA

data.description: Topics in multi-variable calculus and introduction to differential equations.
data.title: TOPICS IN MULTI-VARIABLE CALCULUS AND DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS
